title: (inserted by section 6 of the Health (Miscellaneous Provisions) (No. 2) Act
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Health Act 1970 (Section
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Health Act 1970 (Section 

67E) (Payments in respect of Contraception Services) Regulations 2022. 

(2) These Regulations shall come into operation on the 8th day of 

September 2022.
text_norm: 1 (1) regulation may cited health act 1970 (section 67e) (payments respect contraception services) regulation 2022 (2) regulation shall come operation 8th day september 2022

title: (inserted by section 6 of the Health (Miscellaneous Provisions) (No. 2) Act
heading: In these Regulations, “reimbursement price” has the meaning assigned
text_raw:
2. 

In these Regulations, “reimbursement price” has the meaning assigned 
to it by Regulation 2 of the Health Professionals (Reduction of Payments to 
Community Pharmacy Contractors) Regulations 2011 (S.I. No. 300 of 2011).
text_norm: 2 regulation reimbursement price meaning assigned regulation 2 health professional (reduction payment community pharmacy contractors) regulation 2011 (s.i no 300 2011)

title: (inserted by section 6 of the Health (Miscellaneous Provisions) (No. 2) Act
heading: 3. Subject to Regulation (6), the amount of the payment to be made to a
text_raw:
3. Subject to Regulation (6), the amount of the payment to be made to a 
scheme provider in respect of the provision of an applicable service specified 
in column (2) of Schedule 1 opposite a particular reference number in column 
(1) thereof is prescribed as the amount of the payment specified in column (3) 
thereof.
text_norm: 3 subject regulation (6) amount payment made scheme provider respect provision applicable service specified column (2) schedule 1 opposite particular reference number column (1) thereof prescribed amount payment specified column (3) thereof

title: (inserted by section 6 of the Health (Miscellaneous Provisions) (No. 2) Act
heading: 4. Subject to Regulation (6), the amount of the payment to be made to a
text_raw:
4. Subject to Regulation (6), the amount of the payment to be made to a 
pharmacy provider in respect of the dispensing specified in column (2) of 
Schedule 2 opposite a particular reference number in column (1) thereof is 
prescribed as the sum of the following: 

(a) 

(b) 

the reimbursement price in respect of the particular relevant 
product; 

the amount of the payment specified in column (3) of Schedule 
2 opposite the particular reference number in column (1) 
thereof; 

(c) where the relevant product is an emergency contraceptive that is 
dispensed without a prescription, the amount of the payment 
specified in column (3) of Schedule 3 opposite reference number 
1 in column (1) thereof.
text_norm: 4 subject regulation (6) amount payment made pharmacy provider respect dispensing specified column (2) schedule 2 opposite particular reference number column (1) thereof prescribed sum following (a) (b) reimbursement price respect particular relevant product amount payment specified column (3) schedule 2 opposite particular reference number column (1) thereof (c) relevant product emergency contraceptive dispensed without prescription amount payment specified column (3) schedule 3 opposite reference number 1 column (1) thereof

title: (inserted by section 6 of the Health (Miscellaneous Provisions) (No. 2) Act
heading: 5. Subject to Regulation (6), the amount of the payment specified in
text_raw:
5. Subject to Regulation (6), the amount of the payment specified in 
column (3) of Schedule 3 opposite reference number 2 in column (1) thereof is 
prescribed as a one-off administrative fee to be paid to a pharmacy provider in 
respect of a relevant woman on the first occasion that a relevant product is 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 16th September, 2022.

dispensed to that relevant woman by any pharmacy provider under section 67E 
of the Health Act 1970.

title: (inserted by section 6 of the Health (Miscellaneous Provisions) (No. 2) Act
heading: 6. No payment shall be made to a scheme provider or a pharmacy
text_raw:
6. No payment shall be made to a scheme provider or a pharmacy 
provider, as the case may be, under these Regulations in respect of a relevant 
woman where a charge was imposed on the relevant woman by that scheme 
provider or pharmacy provider in respect of the provision of an applicable 
service or the dispensing of a relevant product.

title: (inserted by section 6 of the Health (Miscellaneous Provisions) (No. 2) Act
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations are made under the Health (Miscellaneous Provisions) 
(No.2) Act 2022. The Regulations provide for the services to be provided and 
fees to be paid to medical practitioners and pharmacists respectively in respect 
of the free contraception scheme for women aged 17-25.
